meanings.definition: A literary work that continues the story of a previous work.
meanings.sent1: The sequel to the book was even more exciting than the first one.
meanings.sent2: I can't wait to read the sequel to my favorite novel.
meanings.sent3: The sequel to the story had a surprising twist at the end.
meanings.sent4: Her life felt like a sequel to a never-ending adventure novel.
meanings.sent5: The sequel brought closure to the characters' journeys in a satisfying way.

meanings.definition: A result or consequence of an earlier event.
meanings.sent1: The argument was the sequel of their misunderstanding.
meanings.sent2: The broken vase was the sequel to the loud crash we heard.
meanings.sent3: The burnt dinner was a sequel to her failed attempt at cooking.
meanings.sent4: His apology was the sequel to his rude behavior earlier.
meanings.sent5: The rainstorm was the sequel to the dark clouds gathering in the sky.

meanings.definition: Something that follows or comes after something else.
meanings.sent1: The dessert was the perfect sequel to the delicious meal.
meanings.sent2: The sequel to the movie was announced to be released next year.
meanings.sent3: The sunny day was the sequel to the stormy night before.
meanings.sent4: The laughter that followed was the perfect sequel to her joke.
meanings.sent5: The peaceful silence was the sequel to the noisy chaos earlier.
